table_definition.comment: Gateway Realm jobs aggregated by day.

columns.comment: DIMENSION: The id related to modw.days.
columns.name: day_id

columns.comment: DIMENSION: The year of the day
columns.name: year

columns.comment: DIMENSION: The day of the year.
columns.name: day

columns.comment: DIMENSION: The resource on which the request was made
columns.name: record_resource_id

columns.comment: DIMENSION: The resource on which the jobs ran
columns.name: task_resource_id

columns.comment: DIMENSION: The organization of the resource that the jobs ran on.
columns.name: resource_organization_id

columns.comment: DIMENSION: The type of the resource on which the jobs ran. References resourcetype.id
columns.name: resourcetype_id

columns.comment: DIMENSION: The id of the resource system account (local username) under which the job ran. References systemaccount.id
columns.name: systemaccount_id

columns.comment: DIMENSION: The method used to submit this job: cli, gateway, ...
columns.name: submission_venue_id

columns.comment: DIMENSION: Task type or event.
columns.name: job_record_type_id

columns.comment: DIMENSION: Type of job: hpc, cloud, hpc-reservation, ....
columns.name: job_task_type_id

columns.comment: DIMENSION: The queue of the resource on which the jobs ran.
columns.name: queue

columns.comment: DIMENSION: The id of allocation these jobs used to run
columns.name: allocation_id

columns.comment: DIMENSION: The id of the account record from which one can get charge number
columns.name: account_id

columns.comment: DIMENSION: The id of the person that requested the resources (e.g., made the reservation or submitted the job.
columns.name: requesting_person_id

columns.comment: DIMENSION: The id of the person that ran the jobs.
columns.name: person_id

columns.comment: DIMENSION: The organization of the person that ran the jobs.
columns.name: person_organization_id

columns.comment: DIMENSION: The NSF status code of the person that ran the jobs. References person.nsfstatuscode_id
columns.name: person_nsfstatuscode_id

columns.comment: DIMENSION: The field of science of the project to which the jobs belong.
columns.name: fos_id

columns.comment: DIMENSION: The PI that owns the allocations that these jobs ran under. References principalinvestigator.person_id
columns.name: principalinvestigator_person_id

columns.comment: DIMENSION: The organization of the PI that owns the project that funds these jobs. References piperson.organization_id
columns.name: piperson_organization_id

columns.comment: DIMENSION: Job time is bucketing of wall time based on prechosen intervals in the modw.job_times table.
columns.name: job_time_bucket_id

columns.comment: DIMENSION: Job wait time is bucketing of wait time based on prechosen intervals in the modw.job_wait_times table.
columns.name: job_wait_time_bucket_id

columns.comment: DIMENSION: Number of nodes each of the jobs used.
columns.name: node_count

columns.comment: DIMENSION: Number of processors each of the jobs used.
columns.name: processor_count

columns.comment: FACT: Pre-determined processor bucket sizes. References processorbucket.id
columns.name: processorbucket_id

columns.comment: FACT: The number of jobs that started during this day.
columns.name: submitted_job_count

columns.comment: FACT: The number of jobs that ended during this day.
columns.name: ended_job_count

columns.comment: FACT: The number of jobs that started during this day.
columns.name: started_job_count

columns.comment: FACT: The number of jobs that were running during this day.
columns.name: running_job_count

columns.comment: FACT: (seconds) The wallduration of the jobs that were running during this period. This will only count the walltime of the jobs that fell during this day. If a job started in the previous day(s) the wall time for that day will be added to that day. Same logic is true if a job ends not in this day, but upcoming days.
columns.name: wallduration

columns.comment: FACT: (seconds) The sum of the square of wallduration of the jobs that were running during this period. This will only count the walltime of the jobs that fell during this day. If a job started in the previous day(s) the wall time for that day will be added to that day. Same logic is true if a job ends not in this day, but upcoming days.
columns.name: sum_wallduration_squared

columns.comment: FACT: (seconds) The amount of time jobs waited to execute during this day.
columns.name: waitduration

columns.comment: FACT: (seconds) The sum of the square of the amount of time jobs waited to execute during this day.
columns.name: sum_waitduration_squared

columns.comment: FACT: The amount of local SUs charged to jobs pertaining to this day. If a job took more than one day, its local_charge is distributed linearly across the days it used.
columns.name: local_charge_su

columns.comment: FACT: The amount of XDSUs charged to jobs pertaining to this day. If a job took more than one day, its local_charge is distributed linearly across the days it used.
columns.name: local_charge_xdsu

columns.comment: FACT: The amount of NUs charged to jobs pertaining to this day. If a job took more than one day, its local_charge is distributed linearly across the days it used.
columns.name: local_charge_nu

columns.comment: FACT: The amount of local SUs charged to jobs pertaining to this day. If a job took more than one day, its local_charge is distributed linearly across the days it used.
columns.name: adjusted_charge_su

columns.comment: FACT: The amount of XDSUs charged to jobs pertaining to this day. If a job took more than one day, its local_charge is distributed linearly across the days it used.
columns.name: adjusted_charge_xdsu

columns.comment: FACT: The amount of NUs charged to jobs pertaining to this day. If a job took more than one day, its local_charge is distributed linearly across the days it used.
columns.name: adjusted_charge_nu

columns.comment: FACT: The amount of local SUs charged to jobs pertaining to this day. If a job took more than one day, its local_charge is distributed linearly across the days it used.
columns.name: task_local_charge_su

columns.comment: FACT: The amount of XDSUs charged to jobs pertaining to this day. If a job took more than one day, its local_charge is distributed linearly across the days it used.
columns.name: task_local_charge_xdsu

columns.comment: FACT: The amount of NUs charged to jobs pertaining to this day. If a job took more than one day, its local_charge is distributed linearly across the days it used.
columns.name: task_local_charge_nu

columns.comment: FACT: The amount of local SUs charged to jobs pertaining to this day. If a job took more than one day, its local_charge is distributed linearly across the days it used.
columns.name: task_adjusted_charge_su

columns.comment: FACT: The amount of XDSUs charged to jobs pertaining to this day. If a job took more than one day, its local_charge is distributed linearly across the days it used.
columns.name: task_adjusted_charge_xdsu

columns.comment: FACT: The amount of NUs charged to jobs pertaining to this day. If a job took more than one day, its local_charge is distributed linearly across the days it used.
columns.name: task_adjusted_charge_nu

columns.comment: FACT: The sum of the square of local_charge of jobs pertaining to this day. If a job took more than one day, its local_charge is distributed linearly across the days it used.
columns.name: sum_local_charge_xdsu_squared

columns.comment: FACT: (seconds) The amount of the cpu time (processor_count * wallduration) of the jobs pertaining to this day. If a job took more than one day, its cpu_time is distributed linearly across the days it used.
columns.name: cpu_time

columns.comment: FACT: (seconds) The sum of the square of the amount of the cpu_time of the jobs pertaining to this day. If a job took more than one day, its cpu_time is distributed linearly across the days it used.
columns.name: sum_cpu_time_squared

columns.comment: FACT: (seconds) The amount of the node time (nodes * wallduration) of the jobs pertaining to this day. If a job took more than one day, its node_time is distributed linearly across the days it used.
columns.name: node_time

columns.comment: FACT: (seconds) The sum of the square of the amount of the node_time of the jobs pertaining to this day. If a job took more than one day, its node_time is distributed linearly across the days it used.
columns.name: sum_node_time_squared

columns.comment: FACT: This is the sum of expansion factor per job multiplied by node_count and the [adjusted] duration of jobs that ran in this days.
columns.name: sum_weighted_expansion_factor

columns.comment: FACT: this is the sum of (node_count multipled by the [adjusted] duration) for jobs that ran in this days.
columns.name: sum_job_weights

columns.comment: METADATA: the ids in the fact table for the rows that went into this row
columns.name: job_id_list

table_definition.name: gatewayfact_by_day
